thread.title: British ISIS fighter blows himself up in suicide bombing in Iraq | Metro News
thread.title_full: British ISIS fighter blows himself up in suicide bombing in Iraq | Metro News

author: Tomeyjes For Metro.Co.Uk
title: British ISIS fighter blows himself up in suicide bombing in Iraq | Metro News
text:
Toby Meyjes for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 21 Feb 2017 7:05 pm The suicide bomber was identified as Abu Zakariya al-Britani (Picture: Twitter) 
A British ISIS fighter is believed to have carried out a suicide bombing outside an army base in Iraq. 
The bomber, named by the terror group as Abu Zakariya al-Britani, is said to have detonated one of four explosives-filled cars in a village in the south of Mosul. Bull on the loose after escaping slaughterhouse in New York City 
According to reports, he was a Muslim convert born as Ronald Fiddler and a former Guantanamo Bay detainee. 
The 50-year-old, also known as Jamal al Harith or Jamal Udeen, was suspected of terrorism by the Americans but freed from the US detention centre in 2004 after lobbying by the British government. 
He turned to Islam in the 1990s and travelled to the Pakistani city of Quetta in 2001 for what he claimed was a religious holiday. Teh attack took place in a village south of Mosul (Picture: Amaq Agency) The 50-year-old, also known as Jamal al Harith or Jamal Udeen, was a former Guantamano Bay detainee (Picture: Amaq Agency) 
He has insisted he tried to enter Iran when the US invaded neighbouring Afghanistan, but was captured and imprisoned by the Taliban on suspicion of being a UK spy. 
Around 850 individuals of national security concern have travelled to join the conflict, according to figures published by the Government last year. 
Of those, just under half have returned to the UK and approximately 15% are dead More
